channel.title: 317 PI Connection problems [5 REP++] [URGENT]
channel.description:
Okay, so I'm using a 317 PI base, I've jarred it all correctly everything loads up. The only problem is, it won't connect.
I've opened port 43594 on my vps, on the run.bat command screen thing it says it's connecting through 43594 which I know is default, I've edited the ip's in client.java in the client folder, all of this has been jarred correctly, the source is running, the client loads up completely. Yet I can't connect. Do you have any ideas?
5 + Rep to anyone who solves it.

item.title: 317 PI Connection problems [5 REP++] [URGENT]
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“EclipseRSPS, post:18, topic:437027”]Just to make SURE the port is open.

canyouseeme.org[/quote][quote=“Resent, post:19, topic:437027”][quote author=EclipseRSPS link=topic=539742.msg3952481#msg3952481 date=1332407134]
Just to make SURE the port is open.

canyouseeme.org
[/quote]

Canyouseeme.org usually doesn’t work depending on what router you have. Ensure that after you have portforwarded you router you create an allowance in the Windows Firewall settings by clicking “add port.” Name it RSPS or whatever and write 43594. Apply and click ok, lemme know your progress.[/quote]

Done it several times, and I’ve portforwarded correctly, the port is OPEN, the ip is SET, but it will not connect at all.
I’ve even used the moparscape ipchanger client, so it’s not my client, i’ve contacted my VPS provider, they said there’s no problems. It must be my source, can one of you tv me?

Read full topic

item.title: 317 PI Connection problems [5 REP++] [URGENT]
item.dc:creator: @Resent Resent
item.description:
@Resent wrote:

[quote=“EclipseRSPS, post:18, topic:437027”]Just to make SURE the port is open.

canyouseeme.org[/quote]

Canyouseeme.org usually doesn’t work depending on what router you have. Ensure that after you have portforwarded you router you create an allowance in the Windows Firewall settings by clicking “add port.” Name it RSPS or whatever and write 43594. Apply and click ok, lemme know your progress.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“whackatre, post:4, topic:437027”]Debugging Steps:

a) Can the client connect to the server via localhost?
b) Can the client connect to the server when the firewall is turned off?
c) Can the client connect to the server via the VPS’s IP?
d) Can the client connect to the server via the hostname?[/quote]

a) Yes
b) No
c) No
d) No

any ideas?

Read full topic

@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Okay, so I’m using a 317 PI base, I’ve jarred it all correctly everything loads up. The only problem is, it won’t connect.

I’ve opened port 43594 on my vps, on the run.bat command screen thing it says it’s connecting through 43594 which I know is default, I’ve edited the ip’s in client.java in the client folder, all of this has been jarred correctly, the source is running, the client loads up completely.
